name: The Truth About Cats and Dogs Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What kind of broadcaster is the heroine, Dr Abby Barnes?
questions.explanation:
Radio vet.

	She's a radio vet. Easy one, given the film title!

questions.text: How does Abby meet her beautiful neighbour, the model Noelle?
questions.explanation:
Overhears an argument.

	Abby intervenes when Noelle is having a row with her abusive boyfriend.

questions.text: What musical instrument does Abby play?
questions.explanation:
Violin & Fiddle.

	Noelle's boyfriend breaks Abby's bow in an argument.

Photography.

	He is a photographer - he first calls Abby over a problem photographing his dog.

Hank.

	Hank is a big affectionate bull mastiff dog.

questions.text: What name does Abby use when she first meets Brian?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Noelle can only think of the name 'Madonna', which Abby hastily abbreviates to Donna.

questions.text: What pet animal does Brian's young friend bring to Noelle and Abby for treatment?
questions.explanation:
Tortoise.

	The tortoise needs an injection - not an easy job!

questions.text: When Brian asks for a piece of her clothing, what does Abby give him?
questions.explanation:
Shoe.

	She throws him a training shoe, not perhaps the romantic gesture he was hoping for.

questions.text: What job does Noelle long to do?
What gift does Brian give Noelle?
questions.explanation:
Book.

	He gives her a copy of Sartre's letters to De Beauvoir, a heavy read for beautiful but dim Noelle, who says 'no-one ever bought me a book without pictures before'.
